blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

body:
Fire and Blood

Game of Thrones S1E10 Rewatch

  • Historically, the Really Big Shit happens in episode 9, so the final episodes can be kind of a slowdown though still great TV
  • Poor Starks. Gloom, despair, agony. It’s all they got.
  • Joffrey is a shit but we knew that
  • Still love Littlefinger and Varys sniping
  • Our Dragon Teens suffer great loss this episode. Jon finds out about Ned’s death, rides off half cocked. Dany experiences probably the worst loss a person can experience, the loss of a baby, and then the loss of Drogo. Not good times for our Baby Targs this episode
  • But….parallels. As Jon steps into ice…..

…..Dany steps into fire.

  • Neither can know what will happen to them but it’s the whole “faith in myself” thing, and this episode really sets both of them on the path to what they will become. If you doubt Jonerys is end game, I invite you to rewatch. They have something to offer this world.
  • The King in the North 1 scene….well done. Poor Robb. Greatjon says it was the dragons they bowed to, and the dragons are gone. Oh no they are motherfucking not, old man. Get ready to dance. Jonerys is coming.

tags: to get me thru the long night
summary:
Baelor
Game of Thrones S1E9 rewatch (In which shit gets real)
This show is so fucking boss. Books aside, what show has the balls...
body:
Baelor

Game of Thrones S1E9 rewatch (In which shit gets real)

  • This show is so fucking boss. Books aside, what show has the balls to kill off its main character and the heretofore most famous cast member, nine goddamn episodes in?
  • Of course we didn’t know at the time that the main characters are actually our two Dragon teens, who are having all the angst and turmoil this episode.
  • First scene is Varys trying to reason with Ned, and Ned being all “But my HONOR.” What is this shit, Karate Kid 2? Sweep the leg, Ned Stark, shit.
  • And then he confesses to some bullshit anyway
  • Does anyone think it makes Ned throw up in his mouth a little when he says Stannis is the rightful heir, when he knows Aegon Motherfucking Targaryen, the true heir, is kicking it at The Wall?
  • Speaking of Egg #2, this ep starts out OK for him. He’s got his burnt hand bandaged, and he gets a sweet new sword.
  • And then his fun parade gets rained on when he finds out that Robb had marched to war, and he throws himself a pity party. Luckily, the OG Maester Uncle Aemon is there, again, to stick a boot up his broody ass like, “Yo, kid, you don’t even know the shit that’s gone down in my life.”
  • And Jon finds out that Maester Aemon is a Targ, and looks at him like he’s seen a literal dragon, and it. Is. Awesome and Priceless
  • But the whole Love is the death of duty speech….Those words are gonna come around on Aegon in Season 8, it is known. This is one of my favorite scenes of the entire fucking series and it gives me so many feels.
  • Dany is having a bad day. Drogo’s wound has festered, and he falls from his horse. Then his blood riders get all, “Can I talk to the man of the house?” And she’s like “I’m the Khaleesi, muthafucka, take your patriarchy elsewhere.”
  • Dany pays the price. Only death can pay for life. If this is revisited in Season 8 and has anyfuckingthing to do with Jon or Boat Baby, I will lose. My. Shit. She’s already shown she’ll turn to desperate measures to try to save her man, with disastrous results. Let us cast a shield of protection around Boat Baby, NOW.
  • Catelyn Stark is marginally less awful in this episode. She starts to show she’s not a complete and total waste of space by negotiating with Mr. Filch Walder Frey to get Robb across that stupid bridge, and she is one proud mama wolf Robb returns from battle
  • Speaking of Robb, he’s delicious and I miss him, and he’s good at this shit.
  • We meet Shae in this episode and learn some of Tyrion’s backstory. I forgot how cheeky Shae was.
  • Bronn is the GOAT.
  • That last scene. That last fucking scene, when the PS4 spokesman finds Arya and stops her from watching Ned’s execution. The last shot with the birds flying away rather than Ned’s head rolling around on the ground is so poignant, and I’m sure some meta person will also explain the symbolism around it, but really I think it just subverts our expectations by showing us that even in the midst of great violence and personal tragedy, the world around us keeps going on as normal. Well done, GOT.

summary: Hello. I notice a lot of people compared Daenerys to Alysanne but I fail to find any parallel between them and I feel Daenerys...
question: Hello. I notice a lot of people compared Daenerys to Alysanne but I fail to find any parallel between them and I feel Daenerys has many more similarities with Rhaenyra. Could you enlighten me ?
answer: I’m actually going to refer this on to @goodqueenaly, who’s much more informed about both Alysanne (I know, what a shocker, right) and Rhaenyra. Hope that’s helpful to you, anon!

summary: A Revelation [tags: Jon/Daenerys, Regency AU, aunt/nephew relationship, scandal]  “And you’ve met your aunt, of course,” the man...
body:
A Revelation

[tags: Jon/Daenerys, Regency AU, aunt/nephew relationship, scandal]

“And you’ve met your aunt, of course,” the man with the thinning hair whose name Jon forgets says, as he steers him by the shoulder through the heaving room of the ball his father has organised on his behalf, to introduce his son to the ton now that it has been announced that Jon Targaryen is miraculously a bastard no longer.

“My aunt—” Jon says dizzily, thinking of all the guests he has met this evening, their overwhelming attentions, their eagerness for his favour, and how not half an hour ago he fled, overwhelmed, to the Orangery for some quiet and happened to chance upon a remarkable woman—

“Yes,” the man says, halting Jon in front of the very same woman who had been in the Orangery, the one with whom he had had such a luminous conversation, a woman so beautiful, so singular in her elegance and passion, even from such a brief conversation, that he had been determined to discover whether or not she was yet betrothed.

“Pardon?” Jon says, his mind utterly unable to grasp the situation before him.

[read more]
